clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Effectiveness and Safety of Inhaled Corticosteroids and Antimicrobial Compounds for Non-CF Bronchiectasis
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Effectiveness and Safety of Inhaled Corticosteroids and Antimicrobial Compounds for Non-CF Bronchiectasis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to provide patients and their physicians with greater understanding of the risks and benefits of commonly used therapies for treatment of non-CF bronchiectasis

detailed_description.textblock: Non-CF bronchiectasis is a chronic inflammatory lung disease that is closely linked to pulmonary NTM disease. Both are rare but rising in incidence and disproportionately affect the elderly and women. Therapy of non-CF bronchiectasis aims to reduce inflammation via either ICS-induced immunosuppression or antibiotic-associated immunomodulation and/or suppression of pathogenic organisms. Both strategies, pursued long-term alone or some cases concomitantly, have inherent risks, and the relative risks and benefits of these differential approaches are poorly studied to date. Ultimately, our study will provide patients and their physicians with greater understanding of the risks and benefits of these therapeutic choices.

primary_outcome.measure: Acquisition of pulmonary nontuberculous mycobacterium (NTM) disease
primary_outcome.description: Among a national cohort of non-CF bronchiectasis patients, we will compare the relative safety of corticosteroid and macrolide therapy with regards to acquisition of pulmonary NTM disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Acquisition of respiratory infection which requires hospitalization
primary_outcome.description: Among a national cohort of non-CF bronchiectasis patients, we will compare the effectiveness of corticosteroid and macrolide therapy with regards to prevention of hospitalized respiratory infection.

arm_group.description: Complete national 2006-2014 Medicare data from Part A, B and D will be obtained from CMS. We will use bronchiectasis ICD-9 codes 494.0 and 494.1 to identify patients with bronchiectasis within Medicare. From this identified bronchiectasis cohort, we will exclude patients with cystic fibrosis (ICD-9 codes 277.00-277.09), HIV infection (042), and a history of organ transplant (V42.0, V42.1, V42.6, V42.7, V42.8).

intervention.description: We will evaluate and compare the clinical effectiveness and safety of long-term inhaled corticosteroid and macrolide antimicrobial therapies
We will evaluate and compare the clinical effectiveness and safety of long-term inhaled corticosteroid and macrolide antimicrobial therapies

study_pop.textblock: Patients within Medicare with a diagnosis of bronchiectasis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Within Medicare data, indicated diagnosis of Bronchiectasis by a Pulmonologist (ICD-9 code 494.0 and/or 494.1)
Exclusion Criteria:
- cystic fibrosis diagnosis, HIV infection, history of organ transplant

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor, Divisions of Infectious Diseases, and Public Health and Preventive Medicine
